intro: Pituranthos korolkowii, commonly known as the Korolkow's beardtongue, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and clusters of tubular, pinkish-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Pituranthos korolkowii is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
